apple.description: Apples are crunchy fruits that come in many varieties like Granny Smith, Red Delicious, and Fuji! They have seeds in the core and crispy flesh.

nutrition_per_medium.carbohydrates: 25 grams - Natural sugars and fiber for energy

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural fruit sugars (fructose) and pectin fiber from the apple tree üçé
nutrient_sources.protein: Amino acids produced by the apple tree
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural oils mainly in the seeds

how_grown: Plant apple seeds or graft onto rootstock
Water regularly and provide full sunlight
Apple trees need cold winters to fruit properly
Trees bloom with beautiful white/pink flowers in spring
Apples develop over summer and ripen in fall

pear.description: Pears are sweet, juicy fruits with a unique texture - soft and grainy when ripe! They're shaped like a teardrop and come in green and red varieties.

nutrition_per_medium.carbohydrates: 26 grams - Natural sugars and lots of fiber

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Fruit sugars and high fiber content from the pear tree üçê

how_grown: Grow from seeds or grafted trees
Need well-drained soil and full sun
Pear trees bloom in early spring
Fruit develops through summer
Harvest when firm, ripen off the tree

banana.description: Bananas are curved yellow fruits that grow in bunches! They're perfect portable snacks and get sweeter as they ripen with brown spots.

nutrition_per_medium.carbohydrates: 27 grams - Quick energy from natural sugars
nutrition_per_medium.protein: 1.3 grams - More protein than most fruits

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural fruit sugars and starch from the banana plant üçå
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural fruit oils in small amounts

how_grown: Grow from banana plant shoots (not seeds!)
Need tropical, warm, humid climate
Plants grow tall with large leaves
Banana bunch forms and grows upward
Harvest green, ripen during shipping

orange.description: Oranges are citrus fruits packed with vitamin C! They have a bright orange peel and juicy segments inside that burst with tangy-sweet flavor.

nutrition_per_medium.protein: 1.2 grams - Small amount of plant protein

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Citrus sugars and fiber from orange tree üçä
nutrient_sources.fat: Essential oils in the peel and minimal fruit oils

how_grown: Grow from seeds or grafted citrus trees
Need warm, sunny climate with mild winters
Trees bloom with fragrant white flowers
Fruit develops and stays green initially
Oranges turn orange when ripe and ready

pineapple.description: Pineapples are tropical fruits with a spiky exterior and sweet, juicy golden flesh inside! They take almost 2 years to grow and are symbols of hospitality.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural fruit sugars from the pineapple plant üçç

how_grown: Grow from pineapple crown or slips
Need tropical climate with lots of sun
Plant grows low to ground with spiky leaves
Single pineapple forms in center after 18 months
Harvest when golden and fragrant

strawberry.description: Strawberries are heart-shaped red berries covered in tiny seeds on the outside! They're actually not true berries botanically, but they're deliciously sweet.

nutrition_per_cup.carbohydrates: 11 grams - Natural berry sugars and fiber
nutrition_per_cup.protein: 1 gram - Small amount of plant protein

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural fruit sugars from strawberry plants üçì
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural oils in the tiny seeds

how_grown: Grow from strawberry runners or plants
Need well-drained soil and full sun
Plants spread along the ground
White flowers bloom in spring
Berries ripen red and sweet in early summer

grapes.description: Grapes are small, round fruits that grow in clusters on vines! They come in green, red, and purple colors and can be sweet or tart.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural fruit sugars from grapevines üçá

how_grown: Grow from grapevine cuttings
Need warm climate and well-drained soil
Vines climb and spread on trellises
Small flowers develop into grape clusters
Harvest in late summer when sweet and ripe

watermelon.description: Watermelons are huge, round fruits with green rinds and juicy red flesh inside! They're mostly water and perfect for hot summer days.

nutrition_per_cup.carbohydrates: 12 grams - Natural fruit sugars and water
nutrition_per_cup.protein: 0.9 grams - Small amount of plant protein

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural sugars from watermelon vines üçâ
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural oils in the black seeds

how_grown: Grow from watermelon seeds
Need hot climate and lots of space
Vines spread across large areas
Yellow flowers bloom and become melons
Harvest when the bottom spot turns creamy yellow
how_to_eat: Seeds can be roasted as snacks

mango.description: Mangoes are tropical fruits with smooth skin and incredibly sweet, creamy orange flesh! They're called the 'king of fruits' in many countries.

nutrition_per_cup.protein: 1.4 grams - Good plant protein for a fruit

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural tropical sugars from mango trees ü•≠
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural fruit oils mainly in the seed

how_grown: Grow from mango seeds or grafted trees
Need tropical, warm climate year-round
Trees grow very tall with dense leaves
Small flowers develop into hanging fruits
Harvest when slightly soft and fragrant

peach.description: Peaches are fuzzy, soft fruits with sweet, juicy flesh and a hard pit in the center! Their skin feels like velvet and they smell amazing when ripe.

nutrition_per_medium.carbohydrates: 13 grams - Natural fruit sugars and fiber

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural sugars from peach trees üçë
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural oils in the pit and minimal fruit oils

how_grown: Grow from peach pits or grafted trees
Need warm summers and cold winter chill
Trees bloom with beautiful pink flowers
Fruit develops and grows fuzzy skin
Harvest when slightly soft and fragrant

apricot.description: Apricots are small, orange fruits with smooth skin and sweet-tart flavor! They're like tiny peaches but with their own unique taste and no fuzz.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural fruit sugars from apricot trees üß°

how_grown: Grow from apricot pits or grafted trees
Need warm, dry climate with cold winters
Trees bloom early with white flowers
Small fruits develop quickly
Harvest when orange and slightly soft

carrots.description: Carrots are orange root vegetables that grow underground! They're crunchy, sweet, and great for your eyes because of beta-carotene.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural sugars stored in the root ü•ï
nutrient_sources.protein: Plant amino acids from soil nutrients

how_grown: Plant carrot seeds directly in soil
Need loose, deep soil for roots to grow
Water regularly but don't overwater
Green tops grow above ground
Harvest when orange roots are full-sized

broccoli.description: Broccoli looks like tiny green trees! It's actually a flower that we eat before it blooms, and it's packed with vitamins and minerals.

nutrition_per_cup.protein: 3 grams - Good plant protein for a vegetable

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Complex carbs from photosynthesis ü•¶
nutrient_sources.protein: Plant proteins concentrated in flower buds

how_grown: Start from broccoli seeds or transplants
Need cool weather and rich soil
Plant grows large leaves first
Green flower head forms in center
Harvest before yellow flowers open

sweet_potato.description: Sweet potatoes are orange root vegetables that are naturally sweet! They're different from regular potatoes and packed with vitamins.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Stored starches and sugars in the root üç†

how_grown: Grow from sweet potato slips (shoots)
Need warm climate and loose soil
Vines spread along the ground
Roots develop underground while vines grow
Harvest before first frost in fall

peas.description: Peas are small, round green vegetables that grow in pods! They're sweet and pop in your mouth, and the pods are edible too in some varieties.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Stored energy in pea seeds üü¢
nutrient_sources.protein: High-quality plant proteins and amino acids

how_grown: Plant pea seeds in cool weather
Provide support for climbing vines
White or purple flowers bloom first
Pods develop and fill with round peas
Harvest when pods are plump but still tender

corn.description: Corn grows on tall stalks with kernels arranged on cobs! Each kernel is actually a seed, and corn comes in yellow, white, and colorful varieties.

nutrition_per_cup.fat: 1.5 grams - Some natural oils in kernels

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Stored starch in corn kernels üåΩ

how_grown: Plant corn seeds in warm soil
Stalks grow very tall with large leaves
Tassels at top release pollen
Ears with silk develop on stalks
Harvest when kernels are plump and milky

cucumber.description: Cucumbers are cool, refreshing vegetables that are mostly water! They have a mild flavor and crunchy texture, perfect for hot days.

nutrition_per_cup.carbohydrates: 4 grams - Mostly water with some natural sugars
nutrition_per_cup.protein: 0.7 grams - Small amount of plant protein

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural sugars and minimal starch ü•í

how_grown: Plant cucumber seeds in warm soil
Provide trellises for vines to climb
Yellow flowers bloom and attract bees
Small cucumbers develop from pollinated flowers
Harvest when firm and dark green

bell_peppers.description: Bell peppers are colorful, sweet peppers that come in red, yellow, orange, and green! They're crunchy and mild, not spicy at all.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural sugars from photosynthesis ü´ë

how_grown: Start from pepper seeds indoors
Transplant to warm, sunny garden
White flowers bloom on bushy plants
Peppers start green and change colors as they ripen
Harvest when full-sized and colorful

spinach.description: Spinach has dark green leaves that are packed with iron and vitamins! Baby spinach is tender while mature spinach has bigger, stronger-flavored leaves.

nutrition_per_cup.protein: 1 gram - Good plant protein for leafy green

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Minimal sugars from photosynthesis ü•¨
nutrient_sources.fat: Trace amounts of natural plant oils

how_grown: Plant spinach seeds in cool weather
Grows quickly in rich, moist soil
Harvest baby leaves early for tenderness
Or let grow to full-size leaves
Pick regularly to encourage new growth

tomato.description: Tomatoes are actually fruits, not vegetables! They have seeds inside, which makes them a fruit. Tomatoes come in many colors like red, yellow, orange, and even purple!

nutrition_per_medium.carbohydrates: 5 grams - Natural fruit sugars and fiber
nutrition_per_medium.protein: 1 gram - Small amount of plant protein
nutrition_per_medium.fat: 0.2 grams - Very low fat, making them light and healthy

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: From sugar and fiber inside the tomato; plants make sugar via photosynthesis üçÖ
nutrient_sources.protein: From amino acids made by the tomato plant
nutrient_sources.fat: From natural oils in the seeds

how_grown: Plant the seed in soil
Water it daily
Provide lots of sunlight
Plant sprouts, grows leaves, then flowers
Green tomato grows and slowly turns red when ripe

cabbage.description: Cabbage forms tight, round heads of layered leaves! It comes in green, purple, and white varieties and can be eaten raw or cooked.

nutrition_per_cup.carbohydrates: 6 grams - Natural sugars and lots of fiber
nutrition_per_cup.protein: 1.3 grams - Good plant protein for a vegetable

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural sugars and fiber from photosynthesis ü•¨

how_grown: Start from cabbage seeds or transplants
Need cool weather and rich soil
Outer leaves grow first
Inner leaves form tight head
Harvest when head feels firm and solid

chicken.description: Chicken is lean white meat that's versatile and popular worldwide! It's a complete protein source with all essential amino acids.

nutrition_per_3oz.carbohydrates: 0 grams - No carbs in plain chicken
nutrition_per_3oz.fat: 3 grams - Low fat, mostly in skin

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: None in plain chicken meat üêî
nutrient_sources.protein: Complete amino acid profile from muscle tissue
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural animal fats, concentrated in skin

how_produced: Chickens are raised on farms
Fed grain-based diets with protein supplements
Raised in coops or free-range environments
Processed at appropriate age for tender meat
Available as whole birds or individual cuts

fish.description: Fish provides excellent lean protein and healthy omega-3 fatty acids! Different types offer varying flavors from mild to rich.

nutrition_per_3oz.carbohydrates: 0 grams - No carbs in plain fish

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: None in plain fish üêü
nutrient_sources.protein: Complete amino acids from muscle tissue
nutrient_sources.fat: Healthy omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids

how_produced: Wild-caught from oceans, lakes, and rivers
Farm-raised in controlled aquatic environments
Fed natural diet or specialized fish feed
Harvested at optimal size and age
Processed fresh or frozen for markets

egg.description: Eggs are complete protein packages from chickens! The white provides protein while the yolk contains healthy fats and vitamins.

nutrition_per_large_egg.protein: 6 grams - Complete protein with all amino acids
nutrition_per_large_egg.fat: 5 grams - Healthy fats concentrated in yolk

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Trace amounts naturally present ü•ö
nutrient_sources.protein: Complete amino acid profile from egg whites and yolk
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural fats and cholesterol from yolk

how_produced: Laid by hens on farms
Hens eat grain-based diets
Eggs collected daily from nests
Cleaned and inspected for quality
Packaged and refrigerated for freshness

beans.description: Beans are protein-rich legumes that come in many varieties like black, kidney, navy, and pinto! They're also high in fiber and complex carbs.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Complex starches and fiber stored in seeds ü´ò

how_grown: Plant bean seeds in warm soil
Some varieties climb while others bush
Nitrogen-fixing bacteria help plants grow
Pods develop containing multiple beans
Harvest when pods are dry and beans rattle inside

lentils.description: Lentils are small, lens-shaped legumes that cook quickly! They come in red, green, brown, and black varieties, each with unique flavors.

nutrition_per_cup.carbohydrates: 40 grams - Complex carbs and high fiber

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Complex starches and fiber in lentil seeds üü§
nutrient_sources.protein: High-quality plant proteins and amino acids

how_grown: Plant lentil seeds in cool weather
Small plants with delicate leaves
Tiny flowers develop into small pods
Each pod contains 1-2 lentil seeds
Harvest when plants dry and pods rattle

tofu.description: Tofu is made from soybeans and has a mild flavor that absorbs other tastes! It comes in different textures from soft to extra-firm.

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Minimal carbs from soybean processing üü´
nutrient_sources.protein: Complete amino acid profile from soybeans

how_produced: Soybeans are soaked and ground into milk
Soy milk is heated and coagulant is added
Curds form and are pressed into blocks
Different pressing times create different textures
Packaged in water to maintain freshness

lean_beef.description: Lean beef comes from cattle and provides complete protein with essential nutrients like iron and B vitamins! Choose cuts with less visible fat.

nutrition_per_3oz.carbohydrates: 0 grams - No carbs in plain beef
nutrition_per_3oz.fat: 8 grams - Varies by cut, lean cuts have less

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: None in plain beef ü•©
nutrient_sources.protein: Complete amino acid profile from muscle tissue
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural animal fats, varies by cut

how_produced: Cattle are raised on pastures or farms
Fed grass, hay, and sometimes grain
Raised for 18-24 months typically
Processed at meat facilities
Different cuts offer varying fat content

turkey.description: Turkey is lean poultry similar to chicken but with a slightly different flavor! It's especially popular during holidays but great year-round.

nutrition_per_3oz.carbohydrates: 0 grams - No carbs in plain turkey
nutrition_per_3oz.fat: 3 grams - Very lean, especially breast meat

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: None in plain turkey meat ü¶É
nutrient_sources.protein: Complete amino acids from muscle tissue
nutrient_sources.fat: Natural animal fats, minimal in breast meat

how_produced: Turkeys are raised on farms
Fed grain-based diets with protein
Raised in controlled farm environments
Processed at appropriate age for tender meat
Available as whole birds or individual cuts

nuts.description: Nuts are protein-rich seeds with healthy fats! Different varieties like almonds, walnuts, and cashews offer unique flavors and nutrients.

nutrition_per_ounce.carbohydrates: 6 grams - Some natural sugars and fiber

nutrient_sources.carbohydrates: Natural sugars and fiber from nut meat ü•ú

how_grown: Nuts grow on trees (most varieties)
Trees bloom with flowers in spring
Nuts develop in shells or hulls
Harvest in fall when nuts are mature
Dried and processed to remove shells
